conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the conductor rod using electromagnetism and mechanics principles.
Induced EMF in the rod is calculated as \( \mathcal{E} = B L v \).
Current in the circuit is determined using Ohm's law as \( I = \frac{B L v}{R + r} \).
Magnetic force on the conductor rod is calculated as \( F_B = \frac{B^2 L^2 v}{R + r} \).
Net force on the conductor rod is \( F_{\text{net}} = m g \sin \theta - \frac{B^2 L^2 v}{R + r} \).
Acceleration of the conductor rod is \( a = g \sin \theta - \frac{B^2 L^2 v}{m(R + r)} \).
At maximum speed, acceleration becomes zero, leading to \( v_{\text{max}} = \frac{m g \sin \theta (R + r)}{B^2 L^2} \).
Time to reach maximum speed is calculated using kinematic equation, resulting in \( t = \frac{m (R + r)^2}{B^2 L^2 (m - R - r)} \).
